title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4002.24 - License requirements for jockey's agent
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4002.24 - License requirements for jockey's agent

State Regulations

In addition to the qualifications set forth in section
4002.8
of this Part: (a) a license as a jockey's agent may be
initially issued only to an applicant who: (1)
is at least 18 years of age; (2)
passes a written or oral test conducted
by the commission, which may include questions on entry and eligibility
requirements for horses to race and the rules and regulations relating to
jockeys, jockey's agents and racing in general; (3)
has submitted to the commission a written
contract or other evidence of appointment by a jockey for whom such applicant
is to act as agent; and
(4)
is
qualified, as determined by the stewards or other commission designee, by
reason of experience, background and knowledge. (b) An applicant may also be initially
licensed as a jockey's agent if the applicant has been licensed as a jockey's
agent in another jurisdiction for at least one year and otherwise satisfies the
commission as to experience and competence. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4002.24

Amended

New

York State Register October 19, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 42, eff. 10/19/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
